image.altText: A world globe in front of a underwater world of reefs and corals with a graph indicating sea surface temperature rising

props.synopsis: After a year of record-breaking heat, a devastating story has been playing out in the world's oceans. Scientists working along the most breathtaking reefs show what led to climate agency NOAA calling a global bleaching event for only the fourth time in history.

title.children: 'Moved to tears': The hottest year on record unleashes a mass coral bleaching tragedy

image.altText: A collage including photos of the Bondi Junction attacker and a young man in the bush, and a tweet.

props.synopsis: For 14 hours over the weekend, Sydney university student Ben Cohen was one of the most reviled men on the internet, falsely accused of the Bondi Junction stabbings. Here's how the lie spread around the world.

title.children: Ben was falsely accused of stabbing six people to death. Here's how this falsehood spread

image.altText: David Pocock holding a press conference at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Since his elevation to the Senate in May 2022, David Pocock has been striking terror into the heart of the establishment, on a mission to hold Canberra to account. Now, he has the Department of Defence in his sights.

title.children: David Pocock is on an accountability mission — and the senator expects answers

props.synopsis: Bishop Mar Mari Emmanuel is in a critical but stable condition following the attack on Monday evening at Christ The Good Shepherd Church in Wakeley.

title.children: Sydney bishop among four allegedly stabbed at Sydney church during livestreamed mass

image.altText: nsw ambulances and police outside the westfield shopping centre at bondi junction after a mass stabbing event

props.synopsis: After the Bondi Junction knife attack on the weekend, there's debate about whether security guards have enough protection and powers to keep themselves, and the public, safe.

title.children: 'They don't stand a chance': After the Bondi Junction attack, do security guards need more powers?

image.altText: A crowd of out-of-focus people walk in front of a large in-focus Coles supermarket sign.

props.synopsis: For years, big retailers have competed at the check-out while tightening the screws on those who stock their shelves and boosting their profits. It's a far cry from the price-fixing tactics of Visy and Richard Pratt — but it seems the jig is up.

title.children: The power of two: Can we rein in the pricing power of our duopolies?

image.altText: Coles and Woolworths branding outside neighbouring supermarkets

props.synopsis: Woolworths and Coles will be interrogated over their rising prices, growing profits and market power by a dedicated Senate committee examining supermarket prices later today. Here's what to expect from their appearances.

title.children: Why are we paying more for groceries? It's one question Coles and Woolworths will likely have to answer today

image.altText: A close-up of Eva Lawler's face side on

props.synopsis: The Territory Labor government lauds its youth curfew in Alice Springs a success, leaving the door open to calling one again in the future. It's a stark difference to the position taken by some senior members in recent years.

title.children: Territory Labor resisted calling a curfew for years. Now they're backing the measure

image.altText: An aerial photo looking at a water covered plain. The water is reflecting the blue sky and the grass is bright green.

props.synopsis: Some cattle stations around Tennant Creek have received close to 1,000 millimetres of rain so far this year, creating a "beautiful and green" landscape.

title.children: Bushfire-ravaged cattle stations come alive with green grass, water and wildlife after record rain

image.altText: A composite image of Benjamin Netanyahu and Joe Biden.

props.synopsis: Israel's military chief vows that his country will respond to the Iranian attack that saw hundreds of drones and missiles fired at its territory.

title.children: Israel says it will respond to Iran's unprecedented aerial attack, as Israel's allies call for restraint

image.altText: Bruce looks serious as he walks through a throng of reporters, wearing suit and tie.

props.synopsis: For the first time, a court has made findings against Bruce Lehrmann, but the dust from Monday's judgment in his defamation case has yet to settle.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case captivated tens of thousands, but it nearly didn't happen

image.altText: Special operations soldier

props.synopsis: A "small amount" of uranium ore and a Geiger counter are secured and contained after being discovered in a solders' bedroom at Holsworthy Barracks.

title.children: 'Potentially hazardous' uranium found in soldier's room at Sydney's Holsworthy Barracks

image.altText: A woman in handcuffs and a tan jumpsuit walks into a room followed by a man in a blue tie and suit

props.synopsis: Hannah Gutierrez is jailed for involuntary manslaughter after mistakenly loading a live round into a revolver Alec Baldwin was using which killed Halyna Hutchins and injured director Joel Souza.

title.children: Rust armourer Hannah Gutierrez sentenced to 18 months in prison

image.altText: A woman wearing high-vis smiles for a selfie

props.synopsis: Katie Watson is trying for a third time to enlist in the Australian Army, but says her use of an ADHD medication has held her back in the past. Experts saying the issue of neurodivergent people serving can be complex, but that they have much to offer the military.

title.children: Katie wants to enlist in the army, but says she's been knocked back for her use of ADHD medication

image.altText: A man walks out of glass doors flanked by a lawyer and journalists.

props.synopsis: Former Liberal staffer Bruce Lehrmann's defamation case against Network Ten and journalist Lisa Wilkinson over coverage of Brittany Higgins's rape allegation has failed. Here are the five key takeaways from Federal Court Justice Michael Lee's judgment.

title.children: Five key takeways from Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation case in the Federal Court

image.altText: A man with a long grey beard and wearing a hat.

props.synopsis: The parents of Joel Cauchi describe their son as tormented after he killed six people and wounded several others at Bondi Junction on the weekend.

title.children: 'I'm sorry he's done this to the nation': Andrew Cauchi breaks down speaking about killer son

image.altText: A worker crouching down in the kitchen as guests stand up and leave.

props.synopsis: A man who chased the Bondi Junction attacker through the shopping centre says a police officer told Joel Cauchi to drop his knife several times before shooting him.

title.children: 'So angry': Wife reacts to husband's decision to chase Bondi Junction killer

image.altText: A dog sleeping with a magpie on it's back

props.synopsis: The Insta-famous magpie that forged a friendship with a Staffordshire terrier pup is returned to the family that raised it without the required permits.

title.children: 'Wiggly bottoms' and cries of happiness as Molly the magpie is reunited with Gold Coast family and canine pal

image.altText: A man wearing a hat and jacket

props.synopsis: The 54-year-old former Test batsman is being held on the Gold Coast over a range charges including assault and one count of breaching bail.

title.children: Former Test cricketer Michael Slater in custody facing stalking, strangulation charges

image.altText: Collage of Taylor Swift, incognito mode with hat, Grimes DJ'ing in sunglasses and Gwen Stefani with Olivia Rodrigo.

props.synopsis: Plus, other entertainment news you might have missed, including Ryan Gosling's best SNL sketches, the NGV's Yayoi Kusama retrospective and more.

title.children: 'Forgive me!': Grimes apologises after disappointing Coachella set, plus the surprises and flops of weekend one

image.altText: Three men stand around a black rocket booster in a sandy environment.

props.synopsis: Iran's deployment of drones and missiles towards Israel represented a big shift in what had been a shadow war fought through Iran's proxies. The big question now is, what will Israel do in response?

title.children: The shift in Iran and Israel's shadow war marks a dangerous moment for the world

image.altText: tall man walking through shop with backpack

props.synopsis: The man's identity remains a mystery after months of work searching missing persons registers and public appeals. Now police are launching a global appeal to return the man's body to his family.

title.children: This man's body was found floating in Maroochy River. Police still don't know who he is

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Lawrence Wong pose for photos shaking hands.

props.synopsis: In the more than 58 years since Singapore was granted its independence, Australia has seen 17 prime ministers, while the island nation has had just three. So, what can we expect from Lawrence Wong when the deputy leader takes over from Lee Hsien Loong next month?

title.children: 'A new generation of leadership': Singapore chooses its fourth PM in six decades — on a $2.5m salary

image.altText: two people face building with police tape

props.synopsis: In the information vacuum immediately following the mass stabbing at Bondi Junction over the weekend, the alt right exploited the opportunity to spread disinformation and hatred on a favourite, lawless social media platform.

title.children: How does an ideologically motivated lie travel from alt-right internet backwaters to a national newsroom?

image.altText: An atmospheric photo of a quarry with hexagonal columns of rock.

props.synopsis: The three Bangladeshi tourists were taking photos at the instafamous Bombo Headland Quarry rock ledge when a large wave washed them into the ocean.

title.children: Overseas tourist drowns after being swept into the sea while taking photos on Bombo rock ledge

image.altText: Karen Brock from Brocklands nursery and garden supplies

props.synopsis: Suppliers of garden plants to Australia's biggest hardware chain are reporting treatment from the company allegedly so severe that the resulting stress on nursery owners has broken up marriages and left some feeling like "slaves" and "serfs".

title.children: 'I thought it would kill me': Bunnings suppliers break silence about hardware chain's strategy

image.altText: Fatal stabbing victim William Holdback.

props.synopsis: Liam Slann, who is accused of murdering William Holdback at Welland early on Wednesday morning, faces the Adelaide Magistrates Court via video link.

title.children: Man accused of murdering William Holdback at Welland faces Adelaide Magistrates Court

image.altText: Piumetharshika Kaneshan

props.synopsis: The federal government's proposed changes to migration law are "entirely incompatible with human rights" and the government should abandon its bill, human rights groups have told a Senate committee scrutinising the legislation.

title.children: Human rights groups air concerns and personal testimonies on government migration bill

image.altText: A person sitting in a garden preparing food

props.synopsis: Best known as the TV host of Consuming Passions and a long-time advocate for the food, wine, and culture of Margaret River and the South West of WA, Parmenter passed away over the weekend.

title.children: ABC TV chef and broadcaster Ian Parmenter of Consuming Passions dies aged 79

image.altText: An image of Brittany Higgins next to an image of Bruce Lehrmann.

props.synopsis: Justice Michael Lee has delivered his judgment in the defamation case brought by Bruce Lehrmann against Network Ten and Lisa Wilkinson, ruling that the evidence had proven Network Ten's substantial truth defence.

title.children: Judge rules that Bruce Lehrmann raped Brittany Higgins 'without caring whether she consented'

image.altText: A man with sunglasses and an umbrella side profile

props.synopsis: A nurse whose husband was one of two people killed in central Queensland crash has told a truck driver he took away her family's "extraordinary man" in an instant.

title.children: Wife's devastation laid bare as truck driver jailed for deadly ambulance crash

image.altText: Arnold tunnel

props.synopsis: Arnold Dix helped thousands of migrant workers who were forced to endure appalling conditions in Qatar in the lead-up to the 2022 FIFA World Cup. This is why he has been anonymous for so long.

title.children: 'World Cup of Shame' workers wanted to share how an Aussie man helped them. This is why he wanted anonymity, until now
